But the courts had never seen a case where a government committed such awful crimes against its own citizens.
data.partBlankContent: After World War II ended, many people who participated in The Holocaust were captured and put on trial at the Nuremberg Trials. However, the peo___ running t__ Trials h__ to fig___ out h__ to de__ with t__ crimes th___ people h__ committed dur___ the Holocaust. At th__ time, courts co___ try peo___ for w__ crimes. data.fullContent: After World War II ended, many people who participated in The Holocaust were captured and put on trial at the Nuremberg Trials. However, the people running the Trials had to figure out how to deal with the crimes these people had committed during the Holocaust. At that time, courts could try people for war crimes. But the courts had never seen a case where a government committed such awful crimes against its own citizens.
data.answer: 第二次世界大战结束后，许多参与大屠杀的人被捕，并在纽伦堡审判。然而，进行审判的人必须弄清楚如何处理这些人在大屠杀期间犯下的罪行。那时，法庭可以审判犯战争罪的人。但法庭从未见过一个政府对本国公民犯下如此可怕的罪行。
